document.docAuthor: Seeman, Owen D., Lindquist, Evert E. & Husband, Robert W.
document.docTitle: Podotarsonemus indicus Seeman & Lindquist & Husband 2018, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A new tribe of tarsonemid mites (Trombidiformes: Heterostigmatina) parasitic on tetrigid grasshoppers (Orthoptera)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new tribe of tarsonemid mites (Trombidiformes: Heterostigmatina) parasitic on tetrigid grasshoppers (Orthoptera)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype . Adult female.
INDIA
, Madras, Dist. Coimbatore, Coimbatore, P.S. Nathan, 5 Jul. 1946 , ex
Scelimena kempi (Hancock)
, RWH VII2010 (slide 1). In UMMZ .

Paratypes . 15 females , 11 males , 2 larvae , as follows. 11 females , 11 males , 1 larva same data as holotype . 3 females , 1 larva, same data as holotype except 26 Nov. 1945 . 1 female , same data as holotype except 3 Nov. 1947 . In UMMZ , except 1 female , 1 male , 1 larva in CNCI and 1 female , 1 male in QM.

Diagnosis. Female and male: Palps with 2 setae; chelicerae without teeth; prodorsal plate with punctate sculpturing; femora Iâ€“II without setae lÊ¹, d ; genua IIâ€“III bare; tarsi IIâ€“III with 5 setae, uÊ¹Ê¹ present; trochanter IV with 1 seta. Female: Setae sc1 present; vestigial setae
v2
expressed as alveoli within prodorsal shield; coxisternal plates IIIâ€“IV separated by longitudinal striae; setae h not attenuate, <30 long; femorogenu IV without seta; tracheal atria fused, post-atrial sac heavily sclerotized, punctate. Male: Genital capsule without copulatory flanges; setae h1 rudimentary, like h2 ; leg I with tibia and tarsus fused; femorogenu IV bare; tibia IV with solenidion and attenuate terminal seta; tarsus IV rudimentary, subterminal. Larva: Setae h1-2 , ps2 attenuate, setae ps1 short; leg I with separate tibia and tarsus, with 2 rudimentary claws.
Description. ADULT FEMALE ( Figures 16â€“17 , n = 9 measured)

Gnathosoma .
Length 57â€“67, width 68â€“71. Palps 9â€“13, with 2 setae (8 and 3 long). Cheliceral stylets 28â€“31, without teeth. Pharynx length 41â€“50, width 20â€“23. Dorsal setae ch 35â€“42, ventral setae su 27â€“32, palpcoxal setae e 7â€“8.

Idiosoma
. Length 242â€“300 (physogastric 600), width 226â€“240. Tracheal atria fused, post-atrial sac heavily sclerotized, punctate, with single long terminal extension of trachea. Prodorsal plate with punctate sculpturing, 103â€“110 long, 148â€“174 wide; with 3 pairs of setae:
v1 21
â€“26, thickened, with small barbs,
sc 1
17â€“21, sc2 67â€“78, and vestigial
v2 .
Distance between setae
v1-v1 63
â€“75,
v2-v2 68
â€“82, sc1-sc1 124â€“140, sc2-sc2 83â€“106,
v1 -sc2
33â€“ 38. Plates C, D, EF with punctate sculpturing. Setae c1, d, e, f thickened, with small barbs,
c 1
18â€“20, c2 51â€“65, d 17â€“20, e 15â€“21, f 15â€“20. Distance between setae c1-c1 122â€“128, c2-c2 201â€“209, c1-c2 35â€“38, d-d 64â€“76, e-e 73â€“ 80, f-f 28â€“34. Plate H variably covered by EF, setae h not attenuate, 11â€“26. Distance between setae h-h 31â€“37. Cupules ia , im , ih present. Setae ps attenuate> 300, distance between setae ps-ps 9â€“12. Coxisternal setae attenuate, 1a 80 (often broken), 2a > 120 (often broken), 3a > 100, 3b > 100. Distance between setae 1a-1a 26â€“31, 2a-2a 59â€“ 63, 3a-3a 15â€“18, 3b-3b 35â€“43; alveolar vestiges of setae 1b and 2b present. Coxisternal plates IIIâ€“IV separated by longitudinal striae; coxisternal plates III convex anteriorly, sometimes just reaching posterior margin of coxisterna II.

Legs. Leg lengths: I 71 â€“73, II 75 â€“79, III 70 â€“73. Leg IV Fe-Ge length 33â€“34, Ti-Ta length 20â€“22. Leg III, femur and genu fused, line of fusion apparent and one specimen with asymmetric separation of femur and genu.

Femur I lÊ¹Ê¹ 5â€“6, vÊ¹Ê¹ 15â€“28; genu I lÊ¹ 9â€“11, lÊ¹Ê¹ 9â€“10, vÊ¹ 3â€“5, vÊ¹Ê¹ 4â€“5; tibia and tarsus I fused, tibial setae d 31â€“34, lÊ¹ 9â€“12, lÊ¹Ê¹ 9â€“11, vÊ¹ 6â€“7, vÊ¹Ê¹ 11â€“13, solenidion Ï† 3â€“4, tarsal setae tcÊ¹ 12â€“14, tcÊ¹Ê¹ 12â€“13, pvÊ¹ 10â€“13, pvÊ¹Ê¹ 8â€“10, s spinelike, 6â€“7, solenidion Ï‰ 7â€“8.
Femur II vÊ¹Ê¹ 15â€“24; tibia II d 24â€“30, lÊ¹ 6â€“11, vÊ¹ 13â€“21, vÊ¹Ê¹ 15â€“25; tarsus II tcÊ¹ 16â€“17, tcÊ¹Ê¹ 18, pvÊ¹ 13â€“15, uÊ¹ spinelike, 7, uÊ¹Ê¹ 6â€“8, solenidion Ï‰ 6â€“7.
Tibia III d 24â€“32, lÊ¹ 14â€“20, vÊ¹ 18â€“22, vÊ¹Ê¹ 17â€“23; tarsus III tcÊ¹ 17â€“22, tcÊ¹Ê¹ 26â€“32, pvÊ¹ 15â€“17, uÊ¹ spine-like, 8, uÊ¹Ê¹ 5â€“ 6.

subSubSection.paragraph: Trochanter IV with seta 11â€“13; tibiotarsus with ventral tibial seta 45â€“60, terminal tarsal seta> 400.
ADULT MALE ( Fig. 18 , n = 5 measured)

Gnathosoma .
Similar to female. Length 61, width 66. Palps 11â€“12. Cheliceral stylets 2 5â€“26 , without teeth. Pharynx length 34â€“35, width 18. Dorsal setae 39â€“41, ventral setae 7, palpcoxal setae 3.

Idiosoma
. Length 170â€“238, width 168â€“179. Prodorsal plate punctate, 74 long, 104â€“105 wide; with 3 pairs of setae (
v1 14
â€“18,
sc 1
17â€“18, sc2 75â€“78) and vestigial
v2 .
Distance between setae
v1-v1 34
â€“38,
v2-v2 44
â€“50, sc1-sc1 87â€“90, sc2-sc2 64â€“
65, v1
-sc 2 29â€“32 . Plate CD punctate. Setae c1 tapering, with few barbs, 7, c2 attenuate, 70â€“84, d with few barbs, 19â€“20; setae
c 1
in nearly transverse alignment with c2 . Plate EF punctate, e 18â€“19, f 16, with few barbs. Distance between setae c1-c1 64, c2-c2 134,
c1-c 2
21â€“25, d-d 33, e-e 47â€“51, f-f 16. Cupules ia , im present. Genital capsule 43 long, 51 wide, bearing alveolar remnants of h1 , h2 ; ventral flanges absent. Coxisternal setae attenuate 1a 30â€“36, 2a 28â€“30, 3a > 190, 3b > 30. Distance between setae 1a-1a 33â€“35, 2a-2a 56â€“59, 3a-3a 19â€“23, 3b-3b 29â€“31; setae 1a at level of or just posterior to ap1, setae 2b usually just posterior to ap2 (one specimen with asymmetrical position of setae 2b far posterior to ap2). Apodemes: ap2 not reaching medially obsolete ap sj; ap5 obsolete.

subSubSection.paragraph: Legs. Leg lengths: I 70 â€“72, II 83 â€“89, III 83 â€“85, IV 52 â€“54. Leg III, femur and genu separate.

Femur I, lÊ¹Ê¹ 5â€“8, vÊ¹Ê¹ 30; genu I lÊ¹ 8â€“12, lÊ¹Ê¹ 7â€“8, vÊ¹ 4, vÊ¹Ê¹ 3â€“4; tibia and tarsus I fused, tibial setae d 44â€“50, lÊ¹ 7â€“10, lÊ¹Ê¹ 10, vÊ¹ 7, vÊ¹Ê¹ 15, solenidion Ï† 5, tarsal setae ftÊ¹ 16, ftÊ¹Ê¹ 15, tcÊ¹ 15â€“17, tcÊ¹Ê¹ 15â€“17, pvÊ¹ 12, pvÊ¹Ê¹ 14, s spine-like, 7, solenidion Ï‰ 7â€“8.
Femur II vÊ¹Ê¹ 25; tibia II d 38â€“42, lÊ¹ 27â€“29, vÊ¹ 10â€“18, vÊ¹Ê¹ 31â€“32; tarsus II pvÊ¹ 6â€“9, tcÊ¹ 18â€“20, tcÊ¹Ê¹ 18â€“20, uÊ¹Ê¹ 5â€“6, uÊ¹ spine-like, 6, solenidion Ï‰ 8.
Tibia III d 32â€“35, lÊ¹ 27â€“30, vÊ¹ 26â€“32, vÊ¹Ê¹ 23â€“25; tarsus III pvÊ¹ 17â€“20, tcÊ¹ 27â€“28, tcÊ¹Ê¹ 25â€“29, uÊ¹ spine-like, 7, uÊ¹Ê¹ 5â€“ 6.
Trochanter IV with seta, 8; femorogenu IV bare; tibia IV Ï† 11, terminal seta attenuate, 150; tarsus IV rudimentary, subterminal.
LARVA ( Fig. 19 , n = 1 measured)

Gnathosoma .
Length 46, width not measurable. Palp length 5, with 2 setae (lengths 6 and minute). Cheliceral stylets 26, without teeth. Pharynx length 29, width 18. Dorsal setae 18, ventral setae 9.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Idiosoma
. Length 225, width 160. Prodorsal plate smooth, 60 long, 95 wide; with 3 pairs of tapering, weakly barbed setae (
v1 10
, sc1 8, sc2 17) and vestigial
v2 .
Distance between setae
v1-v1 28
,
v2-v2 49
, sc1-sc1 not measurable as sc1 missing on left hand side, sc2-sc2
58, v1
-sc2 41. Plates C, D, EF smooth. Setae tapering, weakly barbed, c1 17, c2 14, d 14, e 12, f 15. Distance between setae c1-c1 76, c2-c2 130, c1-c2 30, d-d 28, e-e 41, f-f 13. Plate H smooth, setae h1 long, 65, h2 ventral,> 120. Distance between setae h1 24. Cupules ia , im , ih present. Setae ps1 fine, 8, ps2 attenuate 60. Coxisternal setae attenuate, 1a 36, 2a 41, 3a > 40, 3b 30. Distance between setae 1a-1a 36, 2a-2a 41, 3a-3a 37, 3b-3b 35. Longitudinal striae between coxisterna IIIâ€“IV.

Legs. Femur I, lÊ¹Ê¹ rudimentary, vÊ¹Ê¹ 10; genu I lÊ¹ , lÊ¹Ê¹ rudimentary, vÊ¹ 3, vÊ¹Ê¹ 2; tibia and tarsus I separate, tibial setae d 15, lÊ¹ 4, lÊ¹Ê¹ 4, vÊ¹ 3, vÊ¹Ê¹ 6, solenidion Ï† 3, tarsal setae tcÊ¹ 9, tcÊ¹Ê¹ 9, pvÊ¹ 3, pvÊ¹Ê¹ 6, s spine-like, 5, solenidion Ï‰ 4.
Femur II vÊ¹Ê¹ 7; tibia II d 9, lÊ¹ 5, vÊ¹ 11, vÊ¹Ê¹ 11; tarsus II tcÊ¹ 7, tcÊ¹Ê¹ 12, pÊ¹ 4, uÊ¹ spine-like, 5, uÊ¹Ê¹ 2, solenidion Ï‰ 3.
Tibia III d 9, lÊ¹ 6, vÊ¹ 10, vÊ¹Ê¹ 10; tarsus III tcÊ¹ 6, tcÊ¹Ê¹ 13, pÊ¹ 4, uÊ¹ spine-like, 5, uÊ¹Ê¹ 3. Leg I with 2 rudimentary claws.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Etymology. The species name
indicus
refers to the country where the type specimens were collected.

Differential diagnosis.
Podotarsonemus indicus
belongs to the
australiensis
species group (
P. australiensis , P. indicus , P. zuluensis
) whose females retain a seta on trochanter IV, have longitudinal striae between coxisterna IIIâ€“ IV and have setae h not attenuated. Of these species,
P. indicus
most closely resembles
P. zuluensis
but is distinguished by having: females with tracheal atria fused (free in other
Podotarsonemus
), females with alveolar remnants of setae
v2
within the prodorsal shield (anterolateral invaginations of prodorsal shield in
P. zuluensis
), females and males retaining seta uâ€³ on tarsus II (absent in
P. zuluensis
), males with setae c2 much longer (> Ã—4) than c1 (<Ã— 2 in
P. zuluensis
) and tibia IV having an attenuate terminal seta and subterminal solenidion (lacking terminal seta and solenidion terminal in
P. zuluensis
), and larvae with setae h1-2 and ps2 attenuate (short in
P. zuluensis
).
